Inspired by a conversation with @Mario Carneiro . It feels like the proof pipelines is mostly built on top of:

  • mod_symm: This method is likely used to apply or manipulate symmetry-

  • superpose: A method used for superposition in equational reasoning.

Perhaps there's a need for higher order superpose and mod_symm?

And (most of the proofs; please correct if I'm wrong) are:

  • follow the assumption of negation to contradiction through efficient derivation of equations using mostly those two techniques.

You can see the source code for the proof generation in https://github.com/teorth/equational_theories/blob/2c0084614d094b33d30ac509d1ccd8555ddcf1dd/equational_theories/Generated/VampireProven/src/vampire_proofs.py#L84
Thank you! Didn't know about this script.

Very interesting! Two functions: one for converting proof steps into lean tactics, and the other one for converting statements to lean syntax. And all that regex based atm.

Thank you for sharing!
Michael Bucko has marked this topic as resolved.

Well, I love the atomicity in the proof_maker function. That makes me feel even stronger about the path being to achieve a math knowledge builder through

  1. energy-based models (diffusionese) with the metrics judging both the local quality of the proof as well its potential and expressiveness, (judging mathematical insight by only its local connectedness to the math knowledge base is suboptimal),
  2. greedy construction (while fixing contradictions) through diffusion models.
It's great that it's already available -- since Vampire has been able to achieve ok/good results (correct me if I am wrong) in the ET project.
